meanings.definition: In a fair and impartial manner.
meanings.sent1: She distributed the candies justly among the children.
meanings.sent2: The judge ruled justly in the court case.
meanings.sent3: The robot justly divided the tasks among its parts.
meanings.sent4: The sun justly shared its warmth with all the flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The teacher justly praised every student for their hard work.

meanings.definition: In accordance with what is morally right or fair.
meanings.sent1: The justly decision was applauded by everyone.
meanings.sent2: He was a justly leader who always considered the needs of his people.
meanings.sent3: The justly cat shared its toy with the curious puppy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was justly contagious, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The justly act of kindness touched the hearts of many.

meanings.sent1: She justly earned the top spot in the competition.
meanings.sent2: The promotion was justly given to the hardworking employee.
meanings.sent3: The cake justly disappeared in seconds at the party.
meanings.sent4: His talent justly shone through in his performance.
meanings.sent5: The applause justly filled the concert hall after the amazing performance.
